etymology.description: a water bucket; compare 桶; similar but unrelated to 甬, 角; unrelated to the bottom of 備 and to 甫
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a bucket, likely viewed from above with a handle, conveying a tool or container. Its similarity to forms like 甬 or 角 is coincidental and not etymologically connected; over time the sense broadened to the general idea of employing or using something.

examples.chinese: 我用手机上网(我用手機上網)。
examples.english: I use my phone to go online.

examples.chinese: 请用筷子吃饭(請用筷子吃飯)。
这把钥匙不好用(這把鑰匙不好用)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bǎ yàoshi bù hǎo yòng.
